and his figure came in view through the smoke. He was pressing one hand to his left side, while the other clutched his drooping pistol. His face was pale. Rost6v ran toward him and said something. 
"No-o-o!" muttered D61okhov through his teeth, "no, it's not over." And after stumbling a few staggering steps right up to the saber, he sank on the snow beside it. His left hand was 
bloody; he wiped it on his coat and supported himself with it. His frowning face was pallid and quivered.
